vacant

</chnsep><chn>旅游业</chn></h2><ul eid="travel_ul_3" class="bullet" e_id="13cbac587f0.-55da"><li eid="travel_li_27" e_id="13cbac587f0.-55d9" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>attract/draw/bring</eb> eid="holiday_body_1" e_id="13cbabeaa27.353a"><title eid="holiday_h1_1" e_id="13cbabeaa27.353b" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="12" status="1">holiday / vacation</titled></title><ul eid="holiday_ul_1" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabeaa27.353c"><li eid="holiday_li_1" e_id="13cbabeaa27.353d" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">You use  <eb>holiday</eb>  (or  <eb>holidays</eb>) in <label-g-blk><label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g> </label-g-blk> and  <eb>vacation</eb>  in <label-g-blk><label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g> </label-g-blk> to describe the regular periods of time when you are not at work or school, or time that you spend travelling or resting away from home.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>holiday 或 holidays（英式英语）和 vacation（美式英语）均表示休息日、假日、外出休假期</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="holiday_xgs_5" e_id="13cbabeaa27.3545"><x-g-blk eid="holiday_xg_21"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="holiday_x_21" e_id="13cbabeaa27.3547" e_inline="y" tranID="3" status="6">I get four weeks' holiday/vacation a year.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我一年有四周休假。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="holiday_xg_22"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="holiday_x_22" e_id="13cbabeaa27.3549" e_inline="y" tranID="5" status="6">He's on holiday/vacation this week.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>他本周休假。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="holiday_xg_"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="holiday_x_" e_id="13cbabeaa27.354b" e_inline="y" tranID="7" status="6">I like to take my holiday/vacation in the winter.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我喜欢在冬天休假。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="holiday_xg_24"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="holiday_x_24" e_id="13cbabeaa27.354d" e_inline="y" tranID="9" status="6">the summer holidays/vacation<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>暑假</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="holiday_li_2" e_id="13cbabeaa27.354e" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">In <label-g-blk><label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g> </label-g-blk> a  <eb>holiday</eb>  (or a  <eb>public holiday</eb>) is a single day when government offices, schools, banks and businesses are closed.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>在美式英语中，holiday 或 public holiday 指政府机关、学校、银行和商业机构关门休息的公共假日</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="holiday_xgs_6" e_id="13cbabeaa27.3553"><x-g-blk eid="holiday_xg_25"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="holiday_x_25" e_id="13cbabeaa27.3555" e_inline="y" tranID="11" status="6">The school will be closed Monday because it's a holiday.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>星期一是公共假日，所以学校不上课。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">This is called a  <eb>bank holiday</eb>  in <label-g-blk><label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g></label-g-blk>.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>在英式英语中，公共假日叫做 bank holiday。</chn></und></li><li eid="holiday_li_3" e_id="13cbabeaa27.3559" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>The holidays</eb>  is used in <label-g-blk><label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g> </label-g-blk> to refer to the time in late December and early January that includes Christmas, Hanukkah and the New Year.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>在美式英语中，the holidays 指十二月下旬至一月上旬，包括圣诞节、修殿节和新年在内的这段时间。</chn></und></li><li eid="holiday_li_4" e_id="13cbabeaa27.355d" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Vacation</eb>  in <label-g-blk><label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g> </label-g-blk> is used mainly to mean one of the periods when universities are officially closed for the students.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>在英式英语中，vacation 主要指大学的放假时期。</chn></und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-g></licontent></xhtml:li></xhtml:ol></sn-blk></sn-gs></subentry-g></div><div id="verb" class="cixing_part"><top-g> <hkey><xhtml:a ill/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> sick/a disease/AIDS/breast cancer/a cold/the flu/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> flu/a migraine<chnsep> flu/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> flu<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>得了感冒／流感</chn></und></li><li eid="ill_li_4" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-59c1" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>contract</eb>  a deadly disease/a serious illness/HIV/AIDS<chnsep> hepatitis<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>患上癌症／糖尿病／皮疹／溃疡；出现肝炎症状</chn></und></li><li eid="ill_li_7" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-59bb" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>have </eb>  a heart attack/a stroke<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>损伤／切断神经／动脉／肌腱</chn></und></li></ul><h2 eid="ill_h2_2" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-59b3" e_inline="y" tranID="12" status="6">Being ill<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>病了</chn></h2><ul eid="ill_ul_2" href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> a temperature/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><xhtml:a vaguely

eid="valuables_sngs_1"><sn-blk-nolist><sn-g eid="valuables_sng_1"><def neh="n" noblk="y"><xhtml:a href="d:things">things</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:that">that</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a <xhtml:a href="d:etc">etc</xhtml:a>.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>（尤指私人的）贵重物品</chn></def><unbox type="synonyms" Name="things" eid="thing_unbox_1" e_id="13cbac5155c.11c3"><body eid="thing_body_1" e_id="13cbac5155c.11c4"><title eid="thing_h1_1" e_id="13cbac5155c.11c5" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="26" status="1">things</titled></title><inlinelist><und margined="n">stuff</und> ◇ <und margined="n">property</und> ◇ <und margined="n">possessions</und> ◇ <und margined="n">junk</und> ◇ <und margined="n">belongings</und> ◇ <und margined="n">goods</und> ◇ <und margined="n">valuables</und></inlinelist><p eid="thing_p_1" e_id="13cbac5155c.11ce" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">These are all words for objects or items, especially ones that you own or have with you at a particular time.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以上各词均指东西、物品，尤指个人拥有或随身携带的物件。</chn></und></p><ul eid="thing_ul_2" class="deflist" e_id="13cbac5155c.11cf"><li eid="thing_li_8" e_id="13cbac5155c.11d0" e_inline="y"><unsyn>things</unsyn> <und margined="n"> <label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><q>rather</q> <reg reg="infml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:infml">informal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> objects, clothing or tools that you own or that are used for a particular purpose<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指个人拥有或作特定用途的物品、衣服、用具</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="thing_xgs_32" e_id="13cbac5155c.11d3"><x-g-blk eid="thing_xg_64"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="thing_x_64" e_id="13cbac5155c.11d5" e_inline="y" tranID="5" status="6">Shall I help you pack your things?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我帮你打点行装好吗？</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="thing_xg_65"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="thing_x_65" e_id="13cbac5155c.11d7" e_inline="y" tranID="7" status="6">Bring your swimming things.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>随身带上游泳用品。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="thing_li_9" e_id="13cbac5155c.11d8" e_inline="y"><unsyn>stuff</unsyn> <und margined="n"><gram-g><gram-blk> [<gram href="helpr:infml">informal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> used to refer to a group of objects when you do not know their names, when the names are not important or when it is obvious what you are talking about<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指名称不详、名称无关紧要或所指明确的东西、物品、玩意儿</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="thing_xgs_33" e_id="13cbac5155c.11db"><x-g-blk eid="thing_xg_66"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac5155c.11de" e_inline="y"><unsyn>property</unsyn> <und margined="n"><gram-g><gram-blk> [<gram e_id=""><xhtml:a href="helpgr:u">uncountable</xhtml:a></gram>] </gram-blk></gram-g><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><q>rather</q> <reg reg="fml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:fml">formal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> a thing or things that are owned by sb<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指所有物、财产、财物</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="thing_xgs_34" e_id="13cbac5155c.11e1"><x-g-blk eid="thing_xg_67"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="thing_x_67" e_id="13cbac5155c.11e3" e_inline="y" tranID="22" status="6">This building is government property.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>这座大楼是政府的财产。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="thing_xg_68"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="thing_x_68" e_id="13cbac5155c.11e5" e_inline="y" tranID="24" status="6">Be careful not to damage other people's property.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>小心别损坏别人的财物。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="thing_li_11" e_id="13cbac5155c.11e6" e_inline="y"><unsyn>possessions</unsyn> <und margined="n"> things that you own, especially sth that can be moved<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指个人财产、私人物品（尤指动产）</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="thing_xgs_35" e_id="13cbac5155c.11e8"><x-g-blk eid="thing_xg_69"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="thing_x_69" e_id="13cbac5155c.11ea" e_inline="y" tranID="11" status="6">Prisoners were allowed no personal possessions except letters and photographs.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>囚犯除信件和照片外不允许有任何私人物品。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="thing_li_12" e_id="13cbac5155c.11eb" e_inline="y"><unsyn>junk</unsyn> <und </chnsep><chn>指无用的东西、无价值的东西</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="thing_xgs_36" e_id="13cbac5155c.11ed"><x-g-blk eid="thing_xg_70"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="thing_x_70" e_id="13cbac5155c.11ef" e_inline="y" tranID="13" e_inline="y"><unsyn>belongings</unsyn> <und margined="n"> possessions that can be moved, especially ones that you have with you at a particular time<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指动产，尤指随身物品</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="thing_xgs_37" e_id="13cbac5155c.11f2"><x-g-blk eid="thing_xg_71"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="thing_x_71" e_id="13cbac5155c.11f4" e_inline="y" tranID="15" status="6">Please make sure you have all your belongings with you when leaving the plane.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>请确保在下飞机前带好所有的随身物品。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="thing_li_14" e_id="13cbac5155c.11f5" e_inline="y"><unsyn>goods</unsyn> <und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><reg reg="tech"><xhtml:a href="helpr:specialist">technical</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk><or> or </or><reg-blk><q>rather</q> <reg reg="fml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:fml">formal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> possessions that can be moved<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指动产、（可搬运的）私人财产</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="thing_xgs_38" e_id="13cbac5155c.11f9"><x-g-blk eid="thing_xg_72"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="thing_x_72" e_id="13cbac5155c.11fb" e_inline="y" tranID="17" status="6">He was found guilty of <ebi>handling stolen goods</ebi>.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>他被判犯销赃罪。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="thing_li_15" e_id="13cbac5155c.11fd" e_inline="y"><unsyn>valuables</unsyn> <und margined="n"> things that are worth a lot of money, especially small personal things such as jewellery or cameras<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>尤指私人的贵重物品（如首饰、相机等）</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="thing_xgs_39" e_id="13cbac5155c.11ff"><x-g-blk eid="thing_xg_73"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="thing_x_73" e_id="13cbac5155c.1201" e_inline="y" tranID="19" status="6">Never leave cash or other valuables lying around.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>现金或其他贵重物品请勿乱放。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 eid="thing_h3_1" e_id="13cbac5155c.1202" e_inline="y" tranID="34" status="1">Patterns</h3><ul eid="thing_ul_3" class="bullet" e_id="13cbac5155c.1203"><li eid="thing_li_16" e_id="13cbac5155c.1204" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>personal</eb>  things/stuff/property/possessions/belongings</und></li><li eid="thing_li_17" e_id="13cbac5155c.1206" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">to  <eb>collect/gather/pack</eb>  (up) your things/stuff/possessions/belongings</und></li><li eid="thing_li_18" e_id="13cbac5155c.1208" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">to  <eb>search</eb>  sb's/your/the things/stuff/property/belongings</und></li><li eid="thing_li_19" e_id="13cbac5155c.120a" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">to  <eb>go through</eb>  sb's/your/the things/stuff/belongings</und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-g></sn-blk-nolist></sn-gs></h-g>
</>

tranID="7" status="6">How much are these? They don't have a price on them.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>这些东西卖多少钱？它们都没有标价。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="price_xg_30"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="price_x_30" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9ad" e_inline="y" tranID="9" status="6">I can't afford it <ebi>at that price</ebi>.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>这样的价格我付不起。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="price_li_6" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9af" e_inline="y"><unsyn>cost</unsyn> <und margined="n"> the amount of money that you need in order to buy, make or do sth<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指购买、制造某物或做某事所需的成本、费用、花费</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="price_xgs_13" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9b1"><x-g-blk eid="price_xg_31"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="price_x_31" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9b3" e_inline="y" tranID="11" status="6">A new computer system has been installed at a cost of £80 000.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>新的计算机系统已安装，费用为 8 万英镑。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="price_li_7" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9b4" e_inline="y"><unsyn>value</unsyn> <und margined="n"> how much sth is worth in money or other goods for which it can be exchanged<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指价值</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="price_xgs_14" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9b6"><x-g-blk eid="price_xg_32"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="price_x_32" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9b8" e_inline="y" tranID="13" status="6">The winner will receive a prize <ebi>to the value of</ebi> £1 000.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>获胜者将得到价值为 1 000 英镑的奖品。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><un un="note" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9ba"> <boxtag>NOTE</boxtag> <und margined="n">Especially in British English,  <eb>value</eb>  can also mean how much sth is worth compared with its price.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>尤其在英式英语中，value 亦表示划算程度</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="price_xgs_15" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9bc"><x-g-blk eid="price_xg_33"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="price_x_33" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9be" e_inline="y" tranID="15" status="6">This restaurant is excellent value<gl-blk>(= <gl>is worth the money it costs</gl>)</gl-blk>.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>这家餐馆很合算。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></un></li></ul><h3 eid="price_h3_1" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9c0" e_inline="y" tranID="16" status="6">price, cost or value?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用 price、cost 还是 value？</chn></h3><p eid="price_p_2" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9c1" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">The  <eb>price</eb>  is what sb asks you to pay for an item or service.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>price 指商品或服务的要价</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="price_xgs_16" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9c3"><x-g-blk eid="price_xg_34"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="price_x_34" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9c5" e_inline="y" tranID="18" status="6">to ask/charge a high price<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>要价高；收费高</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="price_xg_35"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx eid="price_wx_1" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9c7">to ask/charge a high cost/value</wx></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">Obtaining or achieving sth may have a  <eb>cost</eb>; the  <eb>value</eb>  of sth is how much other people would be willing to pay for it.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>cost 指获取某物或达到某目的所需的费用；value 指别人愿意为某物付出的价值</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="price_xgs_17" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9ca"><x-g-blk eid="price_xg_36"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="price_x_35" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9cc" e_inline="y" tranID="21" status="6">house prices<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>房屋价格</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="price_xg_37"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="price_x_36" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9ce" e_inline="y" tranID="23" status="6">the cost of moving house<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>搬家费用</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="price_xg_38"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="price_x_37" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9d0" e_inline="y" tranID="25" status="6">The house now has a market value of one million pounds.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>这栋房子目前的市场价值为 100 万英镑。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></p><ul eid="price_ul_3" class="deflist" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9d1"><li eid="price_li_8" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9d2" e_inline="y"><unsyn>expense</unsyn> <und margined="n"> the money that you spend on sth; sth that makes you spend money<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指所花费用、花钱的东西、开销</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="price_xgs_18" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9d4"><x-g-blk eid="price_xg_39"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="price_x_38" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9d6" e_inline="y" tranID="27" status="6">The garden was transformed <ebi>at great expense</ebi>.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>花园改建花了一大笔费用。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="price_xg_40"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="price_x_39" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9d9" e_inline="y" tranID="29" status="6">Running a car is a big expense.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>养一辆车开销很大。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="price_li_9" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9da" e_inline="y"><unsyn>worth</unsyn> <und margined="n"> the financial value of sb/sth<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指人或物的价值</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="price_xgs_19" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9dc"><x-g-blk eid="price_xg_41"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="price_x_40" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9de" e_inline="y" tranID="31" status="3">He has a personal net worth of $10 million.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>他有价值 1 000 万美元的个人净资产。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><un un="note" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9df"> <boxtag>NOTE</boxtag>  <eb>Worth</eb>  is more often used to mean the practical or moral value of sth.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>worth 较常用以指某事物的实际作用或道德意义。</chn></un></li></ul><h3 eid="price_h3_2" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9e0" e_inline="y" tranID="50" status="1">Patterns</h3><ul eid="price_ul_4" class="bullet" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9e1"><li eid="price_li_10" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9e2" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">the  <eb>high</eb>  price/cost/value</und></li><li eid="price_li_11" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9e4" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">the  <eb>real/true</eb>  price/cost/value/worth</und></li><li eid="price_li_12" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9e6" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">to  <eb>put/set</eb>  a price/value  <eb>on</eb>  sth</und></li><li eid="price_li_13" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9e9" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">to  <eb>increase/reduce</eb>  the price/cost/value/expense</und></li><li eid="price_li_14" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9eb" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">to  <eb>raise/double/lower</eb>  the price/cost/value</und></li><li eid="price_li_15" e_id="13cbac28b3d.9ed" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">to  <eb>cut</eb>  the price/cost</und></li></ul></body></unbox><xr-gs firstinblock="n" href="d:Columbia">Columbia</xhtml:a>, <xhtml:a href="d:situated">situated</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:on">on</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:the">the</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:mainland">mainland</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:opposite">opposite</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:Vancouver">Vancouver</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:Island">Island</xhtml:a>. <xhtml:a href="d:It">It</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:is">is</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:the">the</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:largest">largest</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:city">city</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:western">western</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:Canada">Canada</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:and">and</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:its">its</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:chief">chief</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:Pacific">Pacific</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:port">port</xhtml:a>.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>温哥华（加拿大不列颠哥伦比亚省的港口城市，位于温哥华岛对面的大陆上。是加拿大西部最大的城市和该国主要的太平洋港口）</chn></def></sn-g></sn-blk-nolist></sn-gs></h-g>
</>

eid="vandalism_sng_1"><cset cset="crimcrim" eid="vandalism_cset_1"></cset><def neh="n" noblk="y"><xhtml:a href="d:the">the</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:crime">crime</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a <xhtml:a href="d:and">and</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:for">for</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:no">no</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:good">good</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:reason">reason</xhtml:a><chnsep> type="colloc" Name="Crime" eid="crime_unbox_1" e_id="13cbabc0139.6b70"><body eid="crime_body_1" e_id="13cbabc0139.6b71"><title eid="crime_h1_1" e_id="13cbabc0139.6b72" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="34" status="2">Crime<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>犯罪</chn></titled></title><h2 eid="crime_h2_1" e_id="13cbabc0139.6b73" e_inline="y" tranID="1" status="6">Committing a crime<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>犯罪</chn></h2><ul eid="crime_ul_1" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabc0139.6b74"><li eid="crime_li_1" e_id="13cbabc0139.6b75" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>commit</eb>  a crime/a murder/a violent assault/a brutal killing/an armed robbery/fraud<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>犯罪／谋杀罪／暴力侵犯他人身体罪／残杀罪／持械抢劫罪／诈骗罪</chn></und></li><li eid="crime_li_2" e_id="13cbabc0139.6b77" e_inline="y"><und e_id="13cbabc0139.6b79" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>engage/participate in</eb>  criminal activity/illegal practices/acts of mindless vandalism<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>参与犯罪活动／非法活动／愚昧的故意毁坏他人财产的行为</chn></und></li><li eid="crime_li_4" e_id="13cbabc0139.6b7b" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>steal</eb>  sb's wallet/purse/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> mobile phone/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> cell phone<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>偷某人的钱包／手机</chn></und></li><li eid="crime_li_5" e_id="13cbabc0139.6b81" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>rob</eb>  a bank/a person/a tourist<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>抢劫银行／他人／游客</chn></und></li><li eid="crime_li_6" e_id="13cbabc0139.6b83" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>break into/</eb>  <label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk>  <eb>burglarize</eb>  a house/a home/an apartment<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>入室盗窃</chn></und></li><li eid="crime_li_7" e_id="13cbabc0139.6b8b" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>hijack</eb>  a plane/ship/bus<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>劫持飞机／轮船／公共汽车</chn></und></li><li eid="crime_li_8" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>forge </eb>  documents/certificates/passports<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>伪造文件／证件／护照</chn></und></li><li eid="crime_li_11" e_id="13cbabc0139.6b93" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>take/accept/pay sb/offer (sb)</eb>  a bribe<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>索取／收受贿赂；向（某人）行贿</chn></und></li><li eid="crime_li_12" e_id="13cbabc0139.6b95" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>run</eb>  a phishing/an email/an Internet scam<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>进行网络钓鱼／电子邮件／互联网诈骗</chn></und></li></ul><h2 eid="crime_h2_2" e_id="13cbabc0139.6b97" e_inline="y" tranID="14" status="6">Fighting crime<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>打击犯罪</chn></h2><ul eid="crime_ul_2" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabc0139.6b98"><li eid="crime_li_13" e_id="13cbabc0139.6b99" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>combat/fight</eb>  crime/terrorism/corruption/drug trafficking<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>打击犯罪／恐怖主义／腐败／贩毒</chn></und></li><li eid="crime_li_14" e_id="13cbabc0139.6b9b" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>prevent/stop</eb>  credit-card fraud/child abuse/software piracy<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>防止／阻止信用卡诈骗／虐待儿童／软件盗版</chn></und></li><li eid="crime_li_15" e_id="13cbabc0139.6b9d" e_inline="y"><und href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> antisocial behaviour<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>减少／处理／严厉打击持刀／持枪／暴力／街头犯罪／反社会行为</chn></und></li><li eid="crime_li_17" e_id="13cbabc0139.6ba3" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>foil</eb>  a bank raid/a terrorist plot<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>挫败一起银行抢劫案／一次恐怖分子的阴谋</chn></und></li><li eid="crime_li_18" e_id="13cbabc0139.6ba7" e_inline="y" tranID="21" status="6">Investigating crime<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>调查犯罪活动</chn></h2><ul eid="crime_ul_3" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabc0139.6ba8"><li eid="crime_li_19" e_id="13cbabc0139.6baf" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>investigate</eb>  a murder/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><q>especially</q> <xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> a homicide/a burglary/a robbery/the alleged incident<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>调查谋杀案／蓄意杀人案／入室盗窃案／抢劫案／涉嫌的暴力事件</chn></und></li><li eid="crime_li_22" e_id="13cbabc0139.6bb3" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>conduct/launch/pursue</eb>  an investigation (into…)/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><q>especially</q> <xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> a police/murder inquiry<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>进行／开始／继续（对…的）调查／警方调查／谋杀案调查</chn></und></li><li eid="crime_li_" e_id="13cbabc0139.6bb7" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>investigate/reopen</eb>  a criminal/murder <eb>describe/identify</eb>  a suspect/the culprit/the perpetrator/the assailant/the attacker<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>描述／指认嫌疑犯／罪犯／作恶者／攻击者／袭击者</chn></und></li><li eid="crime_li_28" e_id="13cbabc0139.6bc1" </>
variability,variableness

variety is the spice of life

variety meats

vault

venerate

venereal disease

venture
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><div class="cixing_tiaozhuan"><div class="cixing_tiaozhuan_part"><a href="#noun">noun</a>,</div><div class="cixing_tiaozhuan_part"><a href="#verb">verb</a></div></div><div id="noun" show/a programme/a documentary/an episode/a series<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>播放／重播电视节目／纪实电视节目／电视连续剧的一集／系列节目</chn></und></li><li eid="television_li_13" e_id="13cbac5155c.-2607" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>go out/air/be recorded</eb>  live<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>现场直播／录制</chn></und></li><li eid="television_li_14" e_id="13cbac5155c.-2605" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>attract/draw (in)/pull (in)</eb>  viewers<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>吸引观众</chn></und></li><li eid="television_li_15" e_id="13cbac5155c.-2603" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>be a hit with</eb>  viewers/audiences/critics<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>受到电视观众／观众／评论家的喜爱</chn></und></li><li eid="television_li_16" e_id="13cbac5155c.-2601" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>get</eb>  (low/high) ratings<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>有（低／高）收视率</chn></und></li></ul><h2 eid="television_h2_3" e_id="13cbac5155c.-25ff" e_inline="y" tranID="19" status="6">Appearing<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>演出</chn></h2><ul eid="television_ul_3" class="bullet" e_id="13cbac5155c.-25fe"><li eid="television_li_17" e_id="13cbac5155c.-25fd" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>be on/appear on</eb>  television/TV/a TV show<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>在电视上／电视节目中露面</chn></und></li><li eid="television_li_18" e_id="13cbac5155c.-25fb" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>take part in</eb>  a phone-in/a game show/a quiz show/a reality TV show<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>参与热线直播节目／游戏节目／智力游戏节目／电视真人秀</chn></und></li><li eid="television_li_19" e_id="13cbac5155c.-25f9" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>host</eb>  a show/a a chat show<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>主持电视节目／系列节目／游戏节目／智力游戏节目／访谈节目</chn></und></li><li eid="television_li_20" e_id="13cbac5155c.-25f5" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>be/become/work as </eb>  a/an verdict

e_id="13cbabf992f.-482c" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>reach</eb>  a unanimous/majority verdict<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>作出一致的／多数人赞同的裁决</chn></und></li><li eid="justice_li_25" e_id="13cbabf992f.-482a" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>return/deliver/record</eb>  a verdict of not guilty/unlawful killing/accidental death<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>作出／宣布无罪／非法杀人／意外死亡的裁决</chn></und></li><li eid="justice_li_26" e_id="13cbabf992f.-4828" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>convict/acquit</eb>  the defendant of the crime<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>宣判被告有罪／无罪</chn></und></li><li eid="justice_li_27" e_id="13cbabf992f.-4826" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>secure</eb>  a conviction/your acquittal<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>获得有罪／无罪判决</chn></und></li><li eid="justice_li_28" e_id="13cbabf992f.-4824" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>lodge/file </eb>  an appeal<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>提出上诉</chn></und></li><li eid="justice_li_29" e_id="13cbabf992f.-4822" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>appeal (against)/challenge/uphold/overturn</eb>  a conviction/verdict<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>对判决／裁决提出上诉／质疑；维持／撤销判决／裁决</chn></und></li></ul><h2 eid="justice_h2_3" e_id="13cbabf992f.-4820" e_inline="y" tranID="32" status="6">Sentencing and punishment<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>判刑与惩罚</chn></h2><ul eid="justice_ul_3" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabf992f.-481f"><li eid="justice_li_30" e_id="13cbabf992f.-481e" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>pass</eb>  sentence on sb<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>宣布对某人的判决</chn></und></li><li eid="justice_li_31" e_id="13cbabf992f.-481c" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>carry/face/serve</eb>  a seven-year/life sentence<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>会被判处／面临／服七年徒刑／无期徒刑</chn></und></li><li eid="justice_li_32" e_id="13cbabf992f.-481a" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>receive/be given</eb>  the death penalty<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>被判死刑</chn></und></li><li eid="justice_li_33" e_id="13cbabf992f.-4818" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>be sentenced to</eb>  ten years (in prison/jail)<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>被判十年（监禁）</chn></und></li><li eid="justice_li_34" e_id="13cbabf992f.-4816" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>carry/impose/pay</eb>  a fine (of $3 000)/a penalty (of 14 years imprisonment)<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>会被判处／处以／缴纳（3 000 美元的）罚金／（14 年的）监禁</chn></und></li><li eid="justice_li_35" e_id="13cbabf992f.-4814" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>be imprisoned/jailed for</eb>  drug possession/fraud/murder<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>因持有毒品罪／诈骗罪／谋杀罪被监禁</chn></und></li><li eid="justice_li_36" e_id="13cbabf992f.-4812" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>do/serve</eb>  time/ten years<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>服刑；服十年徒刑</chn></und></li><li eid="justice_li_37" e_id="13cbabf992f.-4810" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>be sent to/put sb in/be released from</eb>  jail/prison<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>被送进监狱；把某人送进监狱；被释放出狱</chn></und></li><li eid="justice_li_38" e_id="13cbabf992f.-480e" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>be/put sb/spend X years</eb>  on death verger

</>
verily

version
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="version_hg_1"><top-g> <hkey><xhtml:a href="help:keyword"><symbol type="key">🔑</symbol></xhtml:a></hkey> <h e_id="13cbac60ff3.-5856">ver·sion</h><hawl> <xhtml:a href="help:awl"><boxtag type="awl">AW</boxtag></xhtml:a> e_inline="y"><und margined="n">These are all words for a written or spoken account of events.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以上各词均指对所发生事情的记述、讲述。</chn></und></p><ul eid="report_ul_2" class="deflist" e_id="13cbac3027d.6fb2"><li eid="report_li_4" e_id="13cbac3027d.6fb3" e_inline="y"><unsyn>report</unsyn> <und margined="n"> a written or spoken account of an event, especially one that is published or broadcast<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>尤指刊登或广播的报道</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="report_xgs_15" e_id="13cbac3027d.6fb5"><x-g-blk eid="report_xg_46"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="report_x_46" e_id="13cbac3027d.6fb7" e_inline="y"><unsyn>story</unsyn> <und margined="n"> an account, often spoken, of what happened to sb or of how sth happened; a report of events in a newspaper, magazine or news broadcast<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>常指对所发生事情的口头叙述、描述、（新闻）报道</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="report_xgs_16" e_id="13cbac3027d.6fba"><x-g-blk eid="report_xg_47"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="report_x_47" e_id="13cbac3027d.6fbc" eid="report_x_48" e_id="13cbac3027d.6fbe" e_inline="y" tranID="11" status="6">the front-page story<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>头版报道</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="report_li_6" e_id="13cbac3027d.6fbf" e_inline="y"><unsyn>account</unsyn> <und margined="n"> a written or spoken description of sth that has happened<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指对所发生事情的书面或口头描述、叙述、报告</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="report_xgs_17" e_id="13cbac3027d.6fc1"><x-g-blk eid="report_xg_49"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="report_x_49" e_id="13cbac3027d.6fc3" e_inline="y" tranID="13" status="6">She gave the police a full account of the incident.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她向警方详尽地叙述了所发生的事情。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 eid="report_h3_1" e_id="13cbac3027d.6fc4" e_inline="y" tranID="14" status="6">report or account?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用 report 还是 account？</chn></h3><p eid="report_p_2" e_id="13cbac3027d.6fc5" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">A  <eb>report</eb>  is always of recent events, especially news. An  <eb>account</eb>  may be of recent or past events.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>report 总是指对最新事情的报道，尤指新闻报道。account 可指对最近的或过去的事情的叙述。</chn></und></p><ul eid="report_ul_3" class="deflist" e_id="13cbac3027d.6fc8"><li eid="report_li_7" e_id="13cbac3027d.6fc9" e_inline="y"><unsyn>version</unsyn> <und margined="n"> a description of an event from the point of view of a particular person or group of people<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指特定的人或群体对某事的描述、说法</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="report_xgs_18" e_id="13cbac3027d.6fcb"><x-g-blk eid="report_xg_50"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="report_x_50" e_id="13cbac3027d.6fcd" e_inline="y" tranID="17" status="6">She gave us her version of what had happened that day.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她从她的角度向我们描述了那天发生的事情。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 eid="report_h3_2" e_id="13cbac3027d.6fce" e_inline="y" tranID="22" status="1">Patterns</h3><ul eid="report_ul_4" class="bullet" e_id="13cbac3027d.6fcf"><li eid="report_li_8" e_id="13cbac3027d.6fd0" status="6">I'm <ebi>very much afraid</ebi> that your son may be involved in the crime.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我非常担忧，你儿子可能与这桩罪案有牵连。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="very_li_2" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-565b" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Very</eb>  is not used with past participles that have a passive meaning.  <eb>Much</eb>,  <eb>very much</eb>  or  <eb>greatly</eb>  <label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><reg reg="fml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:fml">formal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> are usually used instead.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>含被动意义的过去分词不与 very e_id="13cbac60ff3.-563f" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Very</eb>  is not used with adjectives and adverbs that already have an extreme meaning. You are more likely to use an adverb such as <ei eid="very_ei_3" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-563d">absolutely</ei>, <ei eid="very_ei_4" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-563c">completely</ei>, etc.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>含极端意义的形容词和副词不用 very，而常用 absolutely、completely 等副词</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="very_xgs_12" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-563b"><x-g-blk eid="very_xg_32"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="very_x_32" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-5639" e_inline="y" tranID="26" status="6">She was absolutely furious.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她愤怒极了。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="very_xg_33"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="very_x_33" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-5637" e_inline="y" tranID="28" status="6">I'm completely exhausted.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我完全筋疲力尽了。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="very_xg_34"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="very_x_34" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-5635" e_inline="y" tranID="30" status="6">You played really brilliantly.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你的表现真是棒极了。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="very_li_5" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-5634" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Very</eb>  is not used with verbs. vested interest

vest in sb/sth

<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><div <head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="vhf_hg_1"><top-g> <h e_id="13cbac60ff3.-5253">VHF</h><pron e eid="vhf_prongs_1" gs href="vhf_prongs_1" psg="ald8_vhf_prongs_1" resource="phonetics" source="ald8" targeteltid="u4cdebea65f7df6b4.65a4283b.1430b37eb0f.10a5" wd="vhf"><pron-g-blk><brelabel><xhtml:a href="help:bre">BrE</xhtml:a></brelabel> <pron-g><xhtml:a href="help:phonetics"><phon-blk>/<phon>ˌviː eɪtʃ ˈef</phon>/</phon-blk><audio eid="vhf_audio_1" name="vhf__gb_1"></audio></xhtml:a></pron-g> <a href="snd://vhf__gb_1.spx"><audio-gb>🔊</audio-gb></a></pron-g-blk><pron-g-blk><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><namelabel><xhtml:a href="help:name">NAmE</xhtml:a></namelabel> <pron-g><xhtml:a href="help:phonetics"><phon-blk>/<phon>ˌviː eɪtʃ ˈef</phon>/</phon-blk><audio eid="vhf_audio_2" name="vhf__us_1"></audio></xhtml:a></pron-g> <a href="snd://vhf__us_1.spx"><audio-us>🔊</audio-us></a></pron-g-blk></pron-gs><pos-g eid="vhf_posg_1"> <pos-blk><pos><xhtml:a href="helpp:abbr">abbreviation</xhtml:a></pos></pos-blk></pos-g></top-g><sn-gs eid="vhf_sngs_1"><sn-blk-nolist><sn-g eid="vhf_sng_1"><def neh="n" noblk="y"><v-gs-blk type="ff"><v-gs><v-g-blk><v-g><v-blk><v e_id="13cbac60ff3.-5249"><xhtml:a href="d:very high frequency">very high frequency</xhtml:a></v></v-blk></v-g></v-g-blk></v-gs></v-gs-blk> (<xhtml:a href="d:a">a</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:range">range</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:of">of</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:radio">radio</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:waves">waves</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:used">used</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:for">for</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:high">high</xhtml:a>-<xhtml:a href="d:quality">quality</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:broadcasting">broadcasting</xhtml:a>)<chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>甚高频，<tw><fthzmark></fthzmark>特高频</tw><fthzmark></fthzmark>（用于高质量广播的无线电波段）</chn></def></sn-g></sn-blk-nolist></sn-gs></h-g>
</>
via

viaduct
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="viaduct_hg_1"><top-g> eid="bright_xg_24"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="bright_x_24" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-3304" e_inline="y" tranID="7" status="6">The sky was a brilliant blue.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>天空一片蔚蓝。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="bright_li_6" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-3303" e_inline="y"><unsyn>vivid</unsyn> <und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><reg reg="approv"><xhtml:a href="helpr:approv">approving</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> (of colours) bright and strong<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指（颜色）耀眼的、鲜艳的、醒目的</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="bright_xgs_13" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-3300"><x-g-blk eid="bright_xg_25"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="bright_x_25" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32fe" e_inline="y" tranID="15" status="6">His eyes were a vivid green.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>他的眼睛碧绿。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="bright_li_7" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32fd" e_inline="y"><unsyn>vibrant</unsyn> <und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><reg reg="approv"><xhtml:a href="helpr:approv">approving</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> (of colours) bright and strong<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指（颜色）耀眼的、鲜艳的、醒目的</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="bright_xgs_14" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32fa"><x-g-blk eid="bright_xg_26"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="bright_x_26" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32f8" e_inline="y" tranID="17" status="6">The room was decorated in vibrant blues and greens.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>那房间以鲜艳的蓝绿两色装饰。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 eid="bright_h3_1" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32f7" e_inline="y" tranID="18" status="6">vivid or vibrant?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用 vivid 还是 vibrant？</chn></h3><ul eid="bright_ul_3" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32f6"><li eid="bright_li_8" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32f5" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">These two words are very similar, but  <eb>vivid</eb>  emphasizes how bright a colour is, while  <eb>vibrant</eb>  suggests a more lively and exciting colour or combination of colours.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>这两个词非常相似，但 vivid 强调颜色鲜艳明亮，而 vibrant 则指色彩或颜色组合活泼而富生气。</chn></und></li></ul><h3 eid="bright_h3_2" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32f2" e_inline="y" tranID="26" status="1">Patterns</h3><ul eid="bright_ul_4" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32f1"><li eid="bright_li_9" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32f0" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">bright/brilliant/vivid/vibrant  <eb>colours</eb> </und></li><li eid="bright_li_10" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32ee" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">bright/brilliant  <eb>light/sunlight/sunshine/eyes</eb> </und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-g></licontent></xhtml:li></xhtml:ol></sn-blk><sn-blk shcut="n"><xhtml:ol start="3"><xhtml:li><licontent><sn-g eid="vibrant_sng_3" n="">(<dis-g><dtxt e_inline="y" eid="vibrant_dtxt_2" status="6" tranid="7"><xhtml:a href="d:of">of</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:music">music</xhtml:a>, <xhtml:a href="d:sounds">sounds</xhtml:a>, <xhtml:a href="d:etc">etc</xhtml:a>.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>音乐、声音等</chn></dtxt></dis-g>) <def neh="n" noblk="y"><xhtml:a href="d:loud">loud</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:and">and</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:powerful">powerful</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>响亮的；洪亮的；强劲的</chn></def><x-gs eid="vibrant_xgs_3"><x-g-blk e_id="13cbac60ff3.-5148" </chnsep><chn>在好莱坞闯出／追求一番事业</chn></und></li></ul><h2 eid="cinema_h2_5" e_id="13cbabb88d0.2ac" e_inline="y" tranID="32" status="6">Describing films<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>描述电影</chn></h2><ul eid="cinema_ul_5" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabb88d0.2ad"><li eid="cinema_li_28" e_id="13cbabb88d0.2ae" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">the camera  <eb>pulls back/pans over sth/zooms in (on sth)</eb> <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>摄影机拉回／追拍／推近…</chn></und></li><li eid="cinema_li_29" e_id="13cbabb88d0.2b0" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">the camera  <eb>focuses on sth/lingers on sth</eb> <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>摄影机聚焦于／长时间拍摄某物</chn></und></li><li eid="cinema_li_30" e_id="13cbabb88d0.2b2" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>shoot sb/show sb</eb>  in extreme close-up<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用特写镜头拍摄／表现某人</chn></und></li><li eid="cinema_li_31" e_id="13cbabb88d0.2b4" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>use</eb>  odd/unusual camera angles<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>采用奇特的／不同寻常的摄影机角度</chn></und></li><li eid="cinema_li_32" e_id="13cbabb88d0.2b6" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>be filmed/shot</eb>  on location/in a studio<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>在外景地／摄影棚拍摄</chn></und></li><li eid="cinema_li_33" e_id="13cbabb88d0.2b8" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>be set/take place</eb>  in London/in the '60s<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以伦敦／60 年代为背景</chn></und></li><li eid="cinema_li_34" e_id="13cbabb88d0.2ba" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>have</eb>  a happy ending/plot twist<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>有美满的结局／出人意料的情节转折</chn></und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-g></licontent></xhtml:li></xhtml:ol></sn-blk><sn-blk shcut="n"><xhtml:ol start="6"><xhtml:li><licontent><sn-g eid="video_sng_6" <head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g sight、view 还是 vision？</chn></h3><ul eid="sight_ul_3" class="bullet" e_id="13cbac3d526.66cc"><li eid="sight_li_6" e_id="13cbac3d526.66cd" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>View</eb>  is more literary than  <eb>sight</eb>  or  <eb>vision</eb>. It is the only word for talking about how well you can see.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>view 较 sight 和 vision 书面化，是其中唯一指视野清晰程度的词</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="sight_xgs_20" e_id="13cbac3d526.66d1"><x-g-blk eid="sight_xg_48"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx eid="sight_wx_1" e_id="13cbac3d526.66d3">I didn't have a good sight/vision of the stage.</wx></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">  <eb>Vision</eb>  must always be used with a possessive pronoun.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>vision 总是与物主代词连用</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="sight_xgs_21" e_id="13cbac3d526.66d5"><x-g-blk eid="sight_xg_49"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="sight_x_48" e_id="13cbac3d526.66d7" e_inline="y" tranID="15" status="6">my/his/her etc. (field of) vision<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我／他／她…的视野</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">It is not used with the prepositions <ei eid="sight_ei_2" e_id="13cbac3d526.66d8">in, into</ei> and <ei eid="sight_ei_3" e_id="13cbac3d526.66d9">out of</ei> that are very frequent with  <eb>sight</eb>  and  <eb>view</eb>.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>vision 不与介词 in、into 和 out of 连用，但 sight 和 view 常与这些介词连用</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="sight_xgs_22" e_id="13cbac3d526.66dc"><x-g-blk eid="sight_xg_50"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx eid="sight_wx_2" e_id="13cbac3d526.66de">There was nobody in vision.</wx></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="sight_xg_51"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx eid="sight_wx_3" e_id="13cbac3d526.66e0">A tall figure came into vision.</wx></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 eid="sight_h3_2" e_id="13cbac3d526.66e1" e_inline="y" tranID="23" status="1">Patterns</h3><ul href="snd://_view__ams_18.spx"><audio-ams-liju>🔊</audio-ams-liju></a></rx-g></x-g-blk></x-gs><unbox type="synonyms" Name="regard" eid="regard_unbox_1" e_id="13cbac3027d.3591"><body eid="regard_body_1" e_id="13cbac3027d.3592"><title eid="regard_h1_1" e_id="13cbac3027d.3593" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="30" status="1">regard</titled></title><inlinelist><und margined="n">call</und> ◇ <und margined="n">find</und> ◇ <und margined="n">consider</und> ◇ <und margined="n">see</und> ◇ <und margined="n">view</und></inlinelist><p eid="regard_p_1" e_id="13cbac3027d.359a" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">These words all mean to think about sb/sth in a particular way.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以上各词均含认为、视为、看待之义。</chn></und></p><ul eid="regard_ul_2" class="deflist" e_id="13cbac3027d.359b"><li eid="regard_li_6" e_id="13cbac3027d.359c" e_inline="y"><unsyn>regard</unsyn> <und margined="n"> to think of sb/sth in a particular way<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指认为、视为、看待</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="regard_xgs_4" e_id="13cbac3027d.359e"><x-g-blk eid="regard_xg_8"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="regard_x_8" e_id="13cbac3027d.35a0" e_inline="y" tranID="5" status="6">He seemed to regard the whole thing as a joke.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>他似乎是把整件事当成玩笑。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="regard_li_7" e_id="13cbac3027d.35a1" e_inline="y"><unsyn>call</unsyn> <und margined="n"> to say that sb/sth has particular qualities or characteristics<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指认为…是、把…看作</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="regard_xgs_5" e_id="13cbac3027d.35a3"><x-g-blk eid="regard_xg_9"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="regard_x_9" e_id="13cbac3027d.35a5" e_inline="y" tranID="26" status="6">I wouldn't call German an easy language.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我并不认为德语是一门容易学的语言。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="regard_li_8" e_id="13cbac3027d.35a6" e_inline="y"><unsyn>find</unsyn> <und margined="n"> to have a particular feeling or opinion about sth<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指认为、感到</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="regard_xgs_6" e_id="13cbac3027d.35a8"><x-g-blk eid="regard_xg_10"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="regard_x_10" e_id="13cbac3027d.35aa" e_inline="y" tranID="28" status="6">You may find your illness hard to accept.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你可能觉得难以接受自己患病。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="regard_li_9" e_id="13cbac3027d.35ab" e_inline="y"><unsyn>consider</unsyn> <und margined="n"> to think of sb/sth in a particular way<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指认为、视为、觉得</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="regard_xgs_7" e_id="13cbac3027d.35ad"><x-g-blk eid="regard_xg_11"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="regard_x_11" e_id="13cbac3027d.35af" e_inline="y" tranID="7" status="6">Who do you consider (to be) responsible for the accident?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你认为谁对这个事故负有责任？</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 eid="regard_h3_1" e_id="13cbac3027d.35b0" e_inline="y" tranID="8" status="6">regard or consider?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用 regard 还是 consider？</chn></h3><p eid="regard_p_2" e_id="13cbac3027d.35b1" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">These two words have the same meaning, but they are used in different patterns and structures. In this meaning  <eb>consider</eb>  must be used with a complement or clause: you can <ei eid="regard_ei_1" e_id="13cbac3027d.35b3">consider sb/sth to be sth</ei> or <ei eid="regard_ei_2" e_id="13cbac3027d.35b4">consider sb/sth as sth</ei>, although very often the <ei eid="regard_ei_3" e_id="13cbac3027d.35b5">to be</ei> or <ei eid="regard_ei_4" e_id="13cbac3027d.35b6">as</ei> is left out.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>上述两词意义相同，但用于不同的句型和结构。用于此义时，consider 必须与补语或从句连用，可说 consider sb/sth to be sth 或 consider sb/sth as sth，不过 to be 或 as 常常省略不用</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="regard_xgs_8" e_id="13cbac3027d.35b7"><x-g-blk eid="regard_xg_12"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="regard_x_12" e_id="13cbac3027d.35b9" e_inline="y" tranID="10" status="6">He considers himself an expert.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>他认为自己是专家。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="regard_xg_13"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="regard_x_13" e_id="13cbac3027d.35bb" e_inline="y" tranID="12" status="6">They are considered a high-risk group.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>他们被视为高危人群。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y"> You can also <ei eid="regard_ei_5" e_id="13cbac3027d.35bc">consider that sb/sth is sth</ei> and again, the <ei eid="regard_ei_6" e_id="13cbac3027d.35bd">that</ei> can be left out.  <eb> Regard</eb>  is used in a narrower range of structures. The most frequent structure is <ei eid="regard_ei_7" e_id="13cbac3027d.35bf">regard sb/sth as sth</ei>; the <ei eid="regard_ei_8" e_id="13cbac3027d.35c0">as</ei> cannot be left out.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用 consider that sb/sth is sth 亦可，that 同样可以省略。regard 可用的句型结构较少，最常用的结构是 regard sb/sth as sth，但 as 不可省略</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="regard_xgs_9" e_id="13cbac3027d.35c1"><x-g-blk eid="regard_xg_14"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx eid="regard_wx_1" e_id="13cbac3027d.35c3">I regard him a close friend.</wx></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y"> You cannot <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>不能说</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="regard_xgs_10" e_id="13cbac3027d.35c4"><x-g-blk eid="regard_xg_15"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx eid="regard_wx_2" e_id="13cbac3027d.35c6">regard sb/sth to be sth</wx></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y"> or <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>或</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="regard_xgs_11" e_id="13cbac3027d.35c7"><x-g-blk eid="regard_xg_16"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx eid="regard_wx_3" e_id="13cbac3027d.35c9">regard that sb/sth is sth</wx></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">However,  <eb>regard</eb>  (but not  <eb>consider</eb>  in this meaning) can also be used without a noun or adjective complement but with just an object and adverb <ei eid="regard_ei_9" e_id="13cbac3027d.35cc">(sb/sth is highly regarded)</ei> or adverbial phrase (<ei eid="regard_ei_10" e_id="13cbac3027d.35cd">regard sb/sth with suspicion/jealousy/admiration)</ei>.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>不过，regard 亦可不与名词或形容词补语连用，只与宾语和副词（如 sb/sth is highly regarded）或副词短语（如 regard sb/sth with suspicion/jealousy/admiration）连用；consider 则不能这样用。</chn></und></p><ul eid="regard_ul_3" class="deflist" e_id="13cbac3027d.35ce"><li eid="regard_li_10" e_id="13cbac3027d.35cf" e_inline="y"><unsyn>see</unsyn> <und margined="n"> to have an opinion of sth<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指认为、看待</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="regard_xgs_12" e_id="13cbac3027d.35d1"><x-g-blk eid="regard_xg_17"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="regard_x_14" e_id="13cbac3027d.35d3" e_inline="y" tranID="18" status="6">Try to see things from her point of view.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>设法从她那个角度去看问题。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="regard_li_11" e_id="13cbac3027d.35d4" e_inline="y"><unsyn>view</unsyn> <und margined="n"> to think of sb/sth in a particular way<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指视为、认为、看待</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="regard_xgs_13" e_id="13cbac3027d.35d6"><x-g-blk eid="regard_xg_18"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="regard_x_15" e_id="13cbac3027d.35d8" e_inline="y" tranID="20" status="6">How do you view your position within the company?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你如何看待你自己在公司中的位置？</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><un un="note" e_id="13cbac3027d.35d9"> <boxtag>NOTE</boxtag> <und margined="n"> <eb>View</eb>  has the same meaning as  <eb>regard</eb>  and  <eb>consider</eb>  but is slightly less frequent and slightly less formal. The main structures are <ei eid="regard_ei_11" e_id="13cbac3027d.35dd">view sb/sth as sb/sth</ei> (you cannot leave out the <ei eid="regard_ei_12" e_id="13cbac3027d.35de">as</ei>) and <ei eid="regard_ei_13" e_id="13cbac3027d.35df">view sb/sth with sth</ei>.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>view 与 regard、consider 意义相同，但略为不常用，也略非正式。主要结构有 view sb/sth as sb/sth（as 不能省略）和 view sb/sth with sth。</chn></und></un></li></ul><h3 eid="regard_h3_2" e_id="13cbac3027d.35e0" e_inline="y" tranID="39" status="1">Patterns</h3><ul eid="regard_ul_4" class="bullet" e_id="13cbac3027d.35e1"><li eid="regard_li_12" e_id="13cbac3027d.35e2" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">to regard/consider/see/view sb/sth  <eb>as</eb>  sth </und></li><li eid="regard_li_13" e_id="13cbac3027d.35e4" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">to regard/consider/see/view sb/sth  <eb>from</eb>  a particular point of view</und></li><li eid="regard_li_14" e_id="13cbac3027d.35e6" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">to find/consider sb/sth  <eb>to be</eb>  sth</und></li><li eid="regard_li_15" e_id="13cbac3027d.35e8" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>generally/usually</eb>  regarded/considered/seen/viewed as sth</und></li><li eid="regard_li_16" e_id="13cbac3027d.35ea" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">to regard/consider/view sb/sth  <eb>favourably/unfavourably</eb> </und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-g></licontent></xhtml:li></xhtml:ol></sn-blk></sn-gs><sn-gs eid="view_sngs_12"><shcut-blk><sdsymb><xhtml:a href="help:sd">➤</xhtml:a></sdsymb><shcut><xhtml:a e_id="13cbac01393.-4460"><title eid="look_h1_1" e_id="13cbac01393.-445f" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="31" status="1">look</titled></title><inlinelist><und margined="n">watch</und> ◇ <und margined="n">see</und> ◇ <und margined="n">view</und> ◇ <und margined="n">observe</und></inlinelist><p eid="look_p_1" e_id="13cbac01393.-4459" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">These words all mean to eid="look_xg_76"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="look_x_76" e_id="13cbac01393.-4453" e_inline="y" tranID="5" status="6">If you look carefully you can just see our house from here.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你要是仔细看，从这里就可以看见我们的房子。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="look_xg_77"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="look_x_77" e_id="13cbac01393.-4451" e_inline="y" tranID="7" status="6">She <ebi>looked at</ebi> me and smiled.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她看了看我，笑了。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="look_li_6" e_id="13cbac01393.-444f" e_inline="y"><unsyn>watch</unsyn> <und margined="n"> to look at sb/sth for a time, paying attention to what happens<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指看、注视、观看、观察</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="look_xgs_53" e_id="13cbac01393.-444d"><x-g-blk eid="look_xg_78"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="look_x_78" e_id="13cbac01393.-4449" e_inline="y" tranID="11" status="6">Watch what I do, then you try.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你注意看我的动作，然后试着做。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="look_li_7" movie.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>晚上我们去看了一场电影。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="look_li_8" e_id="13cbac01393.-4443" e_inline="y"><unsyn>view</unsyn> <und watch television, a film/movie, etc.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指看、观看（尤指仔细观察）；看（电视、电影等）</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="look_xgs_55" e_id="13cbac01393.-4440"><x-g-blk eid="look_xg_81"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x watch、see 还是 view？</chn></h3><p eid="look_p_2" e_id="13cbac01393.-443c" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">You can <ei eid="look_ei_2" e_id="13cbac01393.-443b">see/view a film/movie/programme</ei>, but you cannot<x-gs eid="look_xgs_56" e_id="13cbac01393.-443a"><x-g-blk eid="look_xg_82"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx eid="look_wx_1" e_id="13cbac01393.-4438">see/view television</wx></x-g-blk></x-gs> <eb>View</eb>  is more formal than  <eb>see</eb>  and is used especially in business contexts.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>可以说 see/view a film/movie/programme，但不能说 see/view television。view 较 see 正式，尤用于商务语境。</chn></und></p><ul eid="look_ul_3" class="deflist" e_id="13cbac01393.-4435"><li eid="look_li_9" e_id="13cbac01393.-4434" e_inline="y"><unsyn>observe</unsyn> <und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><reg reg="fml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:fml">formal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> to watch sb/sth carefully, especially to learn more about them or it<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指观察、注视、监视</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="look_xgs_57" e_id="13cbac01393.-4431"><x-g-blk eid="look_xg_83"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="look_x_82" e_id="13cbac01393.-442f" e_inline="y" tranID="20" status="3">The patients were observed over a period of several months.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>这些病人被观察了数月之久。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 eid="look_h3_2" <eb>carefully/closely</eb> </und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-g></licontent></xhtml:li></xhtml:ol></sn-blk><sn-blk shcut="y"><xhtml:ol start="3"><xhtml:li><licontent><sn-g eid="view_sng_14" </chnsep><chn>用 watch、see 还是 view？</chn></h3><p eid="look_p_2" e_id="13cbac01393.-443c" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">You can <ei eid="look_ei_2" e_id="13cbac01393.-443b">see/view a film/movie/programme</ei>, but you cannot<x-gs eid="look_xgs_56" e_id="13cbac01393.-443a"><x-g-blk eid="look_xg_82"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx eid="look_wx_1" e_id="13cbac01393.-4438">see/view television</wx></x-g-blk></x-gs> <eb>View</eb>  is more formal than  <eb>see</eb>  and is used especially in business contexts.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>可以说 see/view a film/movie/programme，但不能说 see/view television。view 较 see 正式，尤用于商务语境。</chn></und></p><ul eid="look_ul_3" class="deflist" e_id="13cbac01393.-4435"><li eid="look_li_9" e_id="13cbac01393.-4434" e_inline="y"><unsyn>observe</unsyn> <und about them or it<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指观察、注视、监视</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="look_xgs_57" e_id="13cbac01393.-4431"><x-g-blk eid="look_xg_83"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="look_x_82" e_id="13cbac01393.-442f" e_inline="y" tranID="20" status="3">The patients were observed over a period of several months.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>这些病人被观察了数月之久。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 eid="look_h3_2" </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>（尤指书名页上的）小花饰，小插图</chn></def></sn-g></licontent></xhtml:li></xhtml:ol></sn-blk></sn-gs></h-g>
</>

</>

</>

virtuous circle

</label-g-blk></top-g><sn-gs eid="virtuouscircle_sngs_1"><sn-blk-nolist><sn-g eid="virtuouscircle_sng_1"><def neh="n" noblk="y"><xhtml:a href="d:a">a</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a </chnsep><chn>得了感冒／流感</chn></und></li><li eid="ill_li_4" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-59c1" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>contract</eb>  a deadly disease/a serious illness/HIV/AIDS<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>受病毒／寄生虫／艾滋病病毒感染</chn></und></li><li eid="ill_li_6" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-59bd" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>develop</eb>  cancer/diabetes/a rash/an ulcer/symptoms of hepatitis<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>患上癌症／糖尿病／皮疹／溃疡；出现肝炎症状</chn></und></li><li eid="ill_li_7" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-59bb" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>have </eb>  a heart attack/a stroke<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>心脏病／中风发作</chn></und></li><li eid="ill_li_8" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-59b9" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>provoke/trigger/produce</eb>  an allergic reaction<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>引起／产生过敏反应</chn></und></li><li eid="ill_li_9" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-59b7" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>block/burst/rupture</eb>  a blood vessel<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>使血管阻塞／破裂</chn></und></li><li eid="ill_li_10" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-59b5" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>damage/sever</eb>  a nerve/an artery/a tendon<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>损伤／切断神经／动脉／肌腱</chn></und></li></ul><h2 eid="ill_h2_2" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-59b3" e_inline="y" tranID="12" status="6">Being ill<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>病了</chn></h2><ul eid="ill_ul_2" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-59b2"><li eid="ill_li_11" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-59b1" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>feel</eb>  <label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> ill/sick/nauseous/queasy<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>感到不适／想吐／恶心</chn></und></li><li eid="ill_li_12" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-59ad" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>be running</eb>  <label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> a temperature/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> a fever<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>发烧</chn></und></li><li eid="ill_li_13" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-59a7" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-59a1" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>suffer from</eb>  asthma/malnutrition/frequent headaches/bouts of depression/a mental disorder<chnsep> e_inline="y" tranID="20" status="6">Treatments<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>治疗</chn></h2><ul eid="ill_ul_3" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5993"><li eid="ill_li_18" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5992" </chnsep><chn>电子邮件和互联网</chn></titled></title><h2 eid="email_h2_1" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-7ac0" e_inline="y" tranID="1" status="6">Email<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>电子邮件</chn></h2><ul eid="email_ul_1" eid="email_ul_3" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-7a93"><li eid="email_li_21" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-7a92" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>visit/check</eb>  a website/an Internet site/sb's video/audio/music/content over the Internet<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>在互联网上流播视频／音频／音乐／内容</chn></und></li><li eid="email_li_30" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-7a80" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>join/participate in/visit/provide</eb>  a(n) (web-based/web/online/Internet/discussion) forum<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>加入／访问／提供（网络）论坛</chn></und></li><li eid="email_li_31" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-7a7e" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>generate/increase/monitor</eb>  Internet traffic<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>产生／增加／监管网络流量</chn></und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-g></licontent></xhtml:li></xhtml:ol></sn-blk><xr-gs firstinblock="n" xt="see"><xrlabel> <xhtml:a href="helpxr:see"> <arrow>➡</arrow>  see also</xhtml:a> </xrlabel><xr-g-blk><xr-g e_targeteltid="13cbac60ff3.-425d"><xh-blk><xh><a xt="cp"><xrlabel> <xhtml:a href="helpxr:cp"> <arrow>➡</arrow>  compare</xhtml:a> </xrlabel><xr-g-blk><xr-g e_targeteltid="13cbabf24c9.6404"><xh-blk><xh><a href="entry://entry://invisible">invisible</a></xh></xh-blk></xr-g></xr-g-blk> </xr-gs></sn-g></licontent></xhtml:li></xhtml:ol></sn-blk></sn-gs></h-g>
</>
visible minority
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>显性少数民族（与占社会主体的民族明显不同）</chn></def></sn-g></sn-blk-nolist></sn-gs></h-g>

visibly

vision

Name="sight" eid="sight_unbox_1" e_id="13cbac3d526.66b0"><body eid="sight_body_1" e_id="13cbac3d526.66b1"><title eid="sight_h1_1" e_id="13cbac3d526.66b2" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="20" status="1">sight</titled></title><inlinelist><und margined="n">view</und> ◇ <und margined="n">vision</und></inlinelist><p eid="sight_p_1" e_id="13cbac3d526.66b6" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">These are all words for the area or distance that you can see from a particular position.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以上各词均指视力范围、视野。</chn></und></p><ul eid="sight_ul_2" class="deflist" e_id="13cbac3d526.66b7"><li eid="sight_li_3" e_id="13cbac3d526.66b8" e_inline="y"><unsyn>sight</unsyn> <und margined="n"> the area or distance that you can see from a particular position<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指视力范围、视野</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="sight_xgs_17" e_id="13cbac3d526.66ba"><x-g-blk eid="sight_xg_44"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="sight_x_44" e_id="13cbac3d526.66bc" e_inline="y" tranID="5" status="6">He looked up the street, but there was no one in sight.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>他朝街上望去，一个人也没看见。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="sight_xg_45"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="sight_x_45" e_id="13cbac3d526.66be" e_inline="y" tranID="7" status="6">Leave any valuables in your car out of sight.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>把贵重物品留在车里看不见的地方。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="sight_li_4" e_id="13cbac3d526.66bf" e_inline="y"><unsyn>view</unsyn> <und margined="n"> <label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><q>rather</q> <reg reg="fml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:fml">formal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> the area or distance that you can see from a particular position<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指视力范围、视野</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="sight_xgs_18" e_id="13cbac3d526.66c2"><x-g-blk eid="sight_xg_46"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="sight_x_46" e_id="13cbac3d526.66c4" e_inline="y" tranID="9" status="6">The lake soon came into view.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>那湖很快便映入眼帘。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="sight_li_5" e_id="13cbac3d526.66c5" e_inline="y"><unsyn>vision</unsyn> <und margined="n"> the area that you can see from a particular position<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指视野</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="sight_xgs_19" e_id="13cbac3d526.66c7"><x-g-blk eid="sight_xg_47"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="sight_x_47" e_id="13cbac3d526.66c9" e_inline="y" tranID="11" status="6">The couple moved outside her field of vision<gl-blk>(= <gl>total area you can see from a particular position</gl>)</gl-blk>.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>这对夫妇离开了她的视野。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 eid="sight_h3_1" e_id="13cbac3d526.66cb" e_inline="y" tranID="12" status="6">sight, view or vision?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用 sight、view 还是 vision？</chn></h3><ul eid="sight_ul_3" class="bullet" e_id="13cbac3d526.66cc"><li eid="sight_li_6" e_id="13cbac3d526.66cd" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>View</eb>  is more literary than  <eb>sight</eb>  or  <eb>vision</eb>. It is the only word for talking about how well you can see.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>view 较 sight 和 vision 书面化，是其中唯一指视野清晰程度的词</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="sight_xgs_20" e_id="13cbac3d526.66d1"><x-g-blk eid="sight_xg_48"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx eid="sight_wx_1" e_id="13cbac3d526.66d3">I didn't have a good sight/vision of the stage.</wx></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">  <eb>Vision</eb>  must always be used with a possessive pronoun.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>vision 总是与物主代词连用</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="sight_xgs_21" e_id="13cbac3d526.66d5"><x-g-blk eid="sight_xg_49"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="sight_x_48" e_id="13cbac3d526.66d7" e_inline="y" tranID="15" status="6">my/his/her etc. (field of) vision<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我／他／她…的视野</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">It is not used with the prepositions <ei eid="sight_ei_2" e_id="13cbac3d526.66d8">in, into</ei> and <ei eid="sight_ei_3" e_id="13cbac3d526.66d9">out of</ei> that are very frequent with  <eb>sight</eb>  and  <eb>view</eb>.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>vision 不与介词 in、into 和 out of 连用，但 sight 和 view 常与这些介词连用</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="sight_xgs_22" e_id="13cbac3d526.66dc"><x-g-blk eid="sight_xg_50"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx eid="sight_wx_2" e_id="13cbac3d526.66de">There was nobody in vision.</wx></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="sight_xg_51"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx eid="sight_wx_3" e_id="13cbac3d526.66e0">A tall figure came into vision.</wx></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 eid="sight_h3_2" e_id="13cbac3d526.66e1" e_inline="y" tranID="23" status="1">Patterns</h3><ul </und></li><li eid="sight_li_11" e_id="13cbac3d526.66ed" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">to  <eb>block</eb>  sb's view/vision</und></li><li eid="sight_li_12" e_id="13cbac3d526.66ef" e_inline="y"><und visiting card
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g href="snd://_vital__uss_2.spx"><audio-uss-liju>🔊</audio-uss-liju></a></rx-g></x-g-blk><x-g-blk e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3a69" eid="vital_xg_4"><xsymb><xhtml:a </cl-blk> <xhtml:a href="x:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="x:our">our</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="x:society">society</xhtml:a>.  <xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>警察在我们的社会中起着极其重要的作用。</chn></x><a href="snd://_vital__gbs_2.spx"><audio-gbs-liju>🔊</audio-gbs-liju></a><a when you are self-employed."><cl-blk><cl><xhtml:a href="x:It">It</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="x:is">is</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="x:vital">vital</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="x:that">that</xhtml:a></cl> </cf-blk><rx e eid="vital_rxg_5" g href="vital_rxg_5" resource="recx" source="ald9" targeteltid="13cba8aaec3.-2219"><x e_id="u4cdebea65f7df6b4.1f34c209.141c1526672.1582" e_inline="y" eid="vital_x_6"
