href="snd://_vital__gbs_4.spx"><audio-gbs-liju>🔊</audio-gbs-liju></a><a href="snd://_vital__ams_4.spx"><audio-ams-liju>🔊</audio-ams-liju></a></rx-g></x-g-blk></x-gs><unbox type="langbank" Name="vital" eid="vital_unbox_1" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3a46"><body eid="vital_body_1" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3a45"><title eid="vital_h1_1" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3a44" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="11" status="1">vital</titled></title><h2 eid="vital_h2_1" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3a43" e_inline="y" tranID="1" status="6">Saying that something is necessary<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>表达某事是必要的</chn></h2><ul eid="vital_ul_1" class="bullet" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3a42"><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="vital_xgs_3" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3a40"><x-g-blk eid="vital_xg_8"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="vital_x_8" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3a3e" e_inline="y" tranID="2" status="6"> <eb>It is vital that</eb> journalists can verify the accuracy of their reports.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>新闻记者能够核实其报道的准确性，这一点至关重要。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="vital_xgs_4" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3a3b"><x-g-blk eid="vital_xg_9"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="vital_x_9" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3a39" e_inline="y" tranID="3" status="6">Journalists play a <eb>vital</eb> / <eb>crucial</eb> role in educating the public.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>新闻记者对教育公众起着极其重要的作用。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="vital_xgs_5" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3a35"><x-g-blk eid="vital_xg_10"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="vital_x_10" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3a33" e_inline="y" tranID="4" status="6">Public trust is a <eb>crucial</eb> issue for all news organizations.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>对所有新闻机构来说，公众的信任是至关重要的问题。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="vital_xgs_6" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3a30"><x-g-blk eid="vital_xg_11"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="vital_x_11" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3a2e" e_inline="y" tranID="5" status="6">The ability to write well is <eb>essential</eb> for any journalist.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>好的笔头功夫对任何一个新闻记者都是非常重要的。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="vital_xgs_7" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3a2b"><x-g-blk eid="vital_xg_12"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="vital_x_12" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3a29" e_inline="y" tranID="6" status="6">The Internet has become an <eb>indispensable</eb> tool for reporters.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>互联网已经成为记者不可或缺的工具。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="vital_xgs_8" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3a26"><x-g-blk eid="vital_xg_13"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="vital_x_13" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3a24" e_inline="y" tranID="7" status="6">In journalism, accuracy is <eb>paramount</eb> /…is <eb>of paramount importance</eb>.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>在新闻工作中，准确至关重要。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="vital_xgs_9" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3a20"><x-g-blk eid="vital_xg_14"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="vital_x_14" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3a1e" e_inline="y" tranID="8" status="6"> <eb>It is imperative that</eb> journalists maintain the highest possible standards of reporting.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>新闻记者的当务之急是尽可能保持最高水平的报道。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><xr-gs xt="synsnoteat"><xrhead> <arrow>➡</arrow> <xrbold><b>synonyms</b></xrbold> at</xrhead><xr-g-blk><xr-g> <xh><xhtml:a href="xid:13cbabd5a4a.-1f98">essential</xhtml:a></xh></xr-g></xr-g-blk></xr-gs><xr-gs xt="langbankat"><xrhead> <arrow>➡</arrow> <b>language bank</b> at</xrhead><xr-g-blk><xr-g> <xh><xhtml:a href="xid:13cbabd5a4a.-6ca6">emphasis</xhtml:a></xh></xr-g></xr-g-blk><xr-g-blk>, <xr-g> <xh><xhtml:a href="xid:13cbabf24c9.-4021">impersonal</xhtml:a></xh></xr-g></xr-g-blk></xr-gs></body></unbox><unbox type="synonyms" Name="essential" eid="essential_unbox_1" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f98"><body eid="essential_body_1" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f97"><title eid="essential_h1_1" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f96" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="6" status="3">essential<chnsep> </chnsep><chn/></titled></title><inlinelist><und margined="n">vital</und> ◇ <und margined="n">crucial</und> ◇ <und margined="n">critical</und> ◇ <und margined="n">decisive</und> ◇ <und margined="n">indispensable</und></inlinelist><p eid="essential_p_1" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f8f" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">These words all describe sb/sth that is extremely important and completely necessary because a particular situation or activity depends on them.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以上各词均表示极其重要、完全必要、必不可少。</chn></und></p><ul eid="essential_ul_2" class="deflist" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f8e"><li eid="essential_li_6" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f8d" e_inline="y"><unsyn>essential</unsyn> <und margined="n">extremely important and completely necessary, because without it sth cannot exist, be made or be successful<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指极其重要的、完全必要的、必不可少的</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="essential_xgs_3" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f8b"><x-g-blk eid="essential_xg_13"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="essential_x_13" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f89" e_inline="y" tranID="5" status="6">Experience is essential for this job.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>对于这个工作，经验是非常重要的。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="essential_li_7" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f88" e_inline="y"><unsyn>vital</unsyn> <und margined="n">essential<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指极其重要的、完全必要的、必不可少的</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="essential_xgs_4" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f86"><x-g-blk eid="essential_xg_14"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="essential_x_14" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f84" e_inline="y" tranID="7" status="6">The police play a vital role in our society.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>警察在我们的社会中起着极其重要的作用。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 eid="essential_h3_1" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f83" e_inline="y" tranID="8" status="6">essential or vital?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用 essential 还是 vital？</chn></h3><p eid="essential_p_2" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f82" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">These words have the same meaning but there can be a slight difference in tone.  <eb>Essential</eb>  is used to state a fact or opinion with authority.  <eb>Vital</eb>  is often used when there is some anxiety felt about sth, or a need to persuade sb that a fact or opinion is true, right or important.  <eb>Vital</eb>  is less often used in negative statements.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以上两词意义相同，但语气稍有区别。essential 用以说明事实或表明权威意见，vital 常用于对某事感到急迫或需要使人信服某一事实或意见确实、正确或重要等情况。vital 较少用于否定句</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="essential_xgs_5" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f7e"><x-g-blk eid="essential_xg_15"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="essential_x_15" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f7c" e_inline="y" tranID="10" status="6">It was vital to show that he was not afraid.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>最重要的是要表现出他毫无畏惧。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="essential_xg_16"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx eid="essential_wx_1" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f7a">Money is not vital to happiness.</wx></x-g-blk></x-gs></p><ul eid="essential_ul_3" class="deflist" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f79"><li eid="essential_li_8" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f78" e_inline="y"><unsyn>crucial</unsyn> <und margined="n">extremely important because a particular situation or activity depends on it<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指至关重要的、关键的</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="essential_xgs_6" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f76"><x-g-blk eid="essential_xg_17"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="essential_x_16" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f74" e_inline="y" tranID="13" status="6">It is crucial that we get this right.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我们把这个问题弄明白是极其重要的。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="essential_li_9" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f73" e_inline="y"><unsyn>critical</unsyn> <und margined="n">extremely important because a particular situation or activity depends on it<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指至关重要的、关键的</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="essential_xgs_7" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f71"><x-g-blk eid="essential_xg_18"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="essential_x_17" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f6f" e_inline="y" tranID="15" status="6">Your decision is critical to our future.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你的决定对我们的将来至关重要。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 eid="essential_h3_2" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f6e" e_inline="y" tranID="16" status="6">crucial or critical?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用 crucial 还是 critical？</chn></h3><p eid="essential_p_3" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f6d" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">These words have the same meaning but there can be a slight difference in context.  <eb>Critical</eb>  is often used in technical matters of business or science;  <eb>crucial</eb>  is often used to talk about matters that may cause anxiety or other emotions.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以上两词意义相同，但使用场合稍有区别。critical 常用于商业或科学的技术问题，crucial 常用于可能引起焦虑或其他情感方面的问题。</chn></und></p><ul eid="essential_ul_4" class="deflist" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f6a"><li eid="essential_li_10" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f69" e_inline="y"><unsyn>decisive</unsyn> <und margined="n">of the greatest importance in affecting the final result of a particular situation<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指决定性的、关键的</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="essential_xgs_8" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f67"><x-g-blk eid="essential_xg_19"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="essential_x_18" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f65" e_inline="y" tranID="19" status="6">She has played a decisive role in the peace negotiations.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她在和谈中起了关键作用。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="essential_li_11" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f64" e_inline="y"><unsyn>indispensable</unsyn> <und margined="n">essential; too important to be without<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指必需的、不可或缺的</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="essential_xgs_9" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f62"><x-g-blk eid="essential_xg_20"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="essential_x_19" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f60" e_inline="y" tranID="21" status="6">Cars have become an indispensable part of our lives.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>汽车已成了我们生活中必不可少的一部分。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 eid="essential_h3_3" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f5f" e_inline="y" tranID="36" status="1">Patterns</h3><ul eid="essential_ul_5" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f5e"><li eid="essential_li_12" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f5d" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">essential/vital/crucial/critical/decisive/indispensable  <eb>for</eb>  sth</und></li><li eid="essential_li_13" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f5b" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">essential/vital/crucial/critical/indispensable  <eb>to</eb>  sth</und></li><li eid="essential_li_14" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f59" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">essential/vital/crucial/critical  <eb>that…</eb> </und></li><li eid="essential_li_15" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f57" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">essential/vital/crucial/critical  <eb>to do sth</eb> </und></li><li eid="essential_li_16" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f55" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">a(n) essential/vital/crucial/critical/decisive/indispensable  <eb>part/factor</eb> </und></li><li eid="essential_li_17" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f53" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>of</eb>  vital/crucial/critical/decisive  <eb>importance</eb> </und></li><li eid="essential_li_18" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f50" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>absolutely</eb>  essential/vital/crucial/critical/decisive/indispensable</und></li></ul></body></unbox><unbox type="langbank" Name="emphasis" eid="emphasis_unbox_1" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6ca6"><body eid="emphasis_body_1" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6ca5"><title eid="emphasis_h1_1" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6ca4" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="12" status="1">emphasis</titled></title><h2 eid="emphasis_h2_1" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6ca3" e_inline="y" tranID="1" status="6">Highlighting an important point<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>强调重点</chn></h2><ul eid="emphasis_ul_1" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6ca2"><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="emphasis_xgs_3" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6ca0"><x-g-blk eid="emphasis_xg_9"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="emphasis_x_9" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6c9e" e_inline="y" tranID="2" status="6">This case <eb>emphasizes</eb> / <eb>highlights</eb> the importance of honest communication between managers and employees.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>这个事例凸显出经理与员工之间坦诚交流的重要性。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="emphasis_xgs_4" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6c9a"><x-g-blk eid="emphasis_xg_10"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="emphasis_x_10" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6c98" e_inline="y" tranID="3" status="6">Effective communication skills are <eb>essential</eb> / <eb>crucial</eb> / <eb>vital</eb>.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>有效的交流技巧是至关重要的。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="emphasis_xgs_5" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6c93"><x-g-blk eid="emphasis_xg_11"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="emphasis_x_11" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6c91" e_inline="y" tranID="4" status="6"> <eb>It should be noted that</eb> this study considers only verbal communication. Non-verbal communication is not dealt with here.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>应该注意的是本研究只考查了言语交流，在此没有涉及非言语交流。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="emphasis_xgs_6" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6c8e"><x-g-blk eid="emphasis_xg_12"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="emphasis_x_12" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6c8c" e_inline="y" tranID="5" status="6"> <eb>It is important to remember that</eb> / <eb>An important point to remember is that</eb> non-verbal communication plays a key role in getting your message across.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>非言语交流在传递信息过程中起着重要的作用，记住这一点非常重要。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="emphasis_xgs_7" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6c88"><x-g-blk eid="emphasis_xg_13"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="emphasis_x_13" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6c86" e_inline="y" tranID="6" status="6">Communication is not only about the words you use but also your body language and, <eb>especially</eb> / <eb>above all</eb>, the effectiveness with which you listen.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>交流不仅涉及使用的词语，同时也涉及身体语言，尤其与能否有效听取对方的话有关。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="emphasis_xgs_8" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6c82"><x-g-blk eid="emphasis_xg_14"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="emphasis_x_14" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6c80" e_inline="y" tranID="7" status="6">I would like to <eb>draw attention to</eb> the role of listening in effective communication.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我想让大家注意倾听在有效交流中扮演的角色。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="emphasis_xgs_9" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6c7d"><x-g-blk eid="emphasis_xg_15"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="emphasis_x_15" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6c7b" e_inline="y" tranID="8" status="6">Choose your words carefully: <eb>in particular</eb>, avoid confusing and ambiguous language.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>注意用词，特别是避免使用令人费解和有歧义的语言。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="emphasis_xgs_10" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6c78"><x-g-blk eid="emphasis_xg_16"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="emphasis_x_16" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6c76" e_inline="y" tranID="9" status="6">Finally, and perhaps <eb>most importantly</eb>, you must learn to listen as well as to speak.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>最后，也许是最重要的，你不仅要学会说还要学会听。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><xr-gs xt="useat"><xrhead> <arrow>➡</arrow> note at</xrhead><xr-g-blk><xr-g> <xh><xhtml:a href="xid:13cbabd5a4a.-1f98">essential</xhtml:a></xh></xr-g></xr-g-blk></xr-gs><xr-gs xt="langbankat"><xrhead> <arrow>➡</arrow> <b>language bank</b> at</xrhead><xr-g-blk><xr-g> <xh><xhtml:a href="xid:13cbac60ff3.-3a46">vital</xhtml:a></xh></xr-g></xr-g-blk></xr-gs></body></unbox></sn-g></licontent></xhtml:li></xhtml:ol></sn-blk><sn-blk shcut="n"><xhtml:ol noblk="y"><xhtml:a href="d:connected">connected</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:with">with</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:or">or</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:necessary">necessary</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:for">for</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:staying">staying</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:alive">alive</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>生命的；维持生命所必需的</chn></def><x-gs eid="vital_xgs_2"><x-g-blk e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3a52" eid="vital_xg_7"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbac60ff3.-3a52">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3a51" e_inline="y" eid="vital_x_7" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-330f" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">These words all describe things that are shining or full of light or colours that are strong and easy to see.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以上各词均形容事物明亮、光线充足、鲜艳夺目。</chn></und></p><ul eid="bright_ul_2" class="deflist" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-330e"><li eid="bright_li_4" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-330d" e_inline="y"><unsyn>bright</unsyn> <und margined="n">full of light; shining strongly; (of colours) strong and easy to see<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指光线充足的、明亮的、色彩鲜明的</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="bright_xgs_11" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-330b"><x-g-blk eid="bright_li_5" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-3308" e_inline="y"><unsyn>brilliant</unsyn> <und margined="n">very bright<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指明亮的、鲜艳的</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="bright_xgs_12" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-3306"><x-g-blk eid="bright_xg_24"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="bright_x_24" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-3304" e_inline="y" tranID="7" status="6">The sky was a brilliant blue.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>天空一片蔚蓝。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="bright_li_6" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-3303" e_inline="y"><unsyn>vivid</unsyn> <und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><reg eid="bright_xgs_13" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-3300"><x-g-blk eid="bright_xg_25"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="bright_x_25" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32fe" e_inline="y" tranID="15" status="6">His eyes were a vivid </chnsep><chn>指（颜色）耀眼的、鲜艳的、醒目的</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="bright_xgs_14" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32fa"><x-g-blk eid="bright_xg_26"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="bright_x_26" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32f8" e_inline="y" tranID="17" status="6">The room was decorated in vibrant blues and greens.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>那房间以鲜艳的蓝绿两色装饰。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 eid="bright_h3_1" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32f7" e_inline="y" tranID="18" status="6">vivid or vibrant?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用 vivid 还是 vibrant？</chn></h3><ul eid="bright_ul_3" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32f6"><li eid="bright_li_8" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32f5" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">These two words are very similar, but  <eb>vivid</eb>  emphasizes how bright a colour is, while  <eb>vibrant</eb>  suggests a more lively and exciting colour or combination of colours.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>这两个词非常相似，但 vivid 强调颜色鲜艳明亮，而 vibrant 则指色彩或颜色组合活泼而富生气。</chn></und></li></ul><h3 eid="bright_h3_2" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32f2" e_inline="y" tranID="26" status="1">Patterns</h3><ul eid="bright_ul_4" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32f1"><li eid="bright_li_9" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32f0" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">bright/brilliant/vivid/vibrant  <eb>colours</eb> </und></li><li eid="bright_li_10" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32ee" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">bright/brilliant  <eb>light/sunlight/sunshine/eyes</eb> </und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-g></licontent></xhtml:li></xhtml:ol></sn-blk><sn-blk shcut="n"><xhtml:ol start="3"><xhtml:li><licontent><sn-g eid="vivid_sng_3" n="">(<dis-g><dtxt e_inline="y" eid="vivid_dtxt_3" status="6" tranid="8"><xhtml:a href="d:of">of</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:sb's">sb's</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:imagination">imagination</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn>人的想象</chn></dtxt></dis-g>) <def neh="n" noblk="y"><xhtml:a href="d:able">able</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:to">to</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a <xhtml:a href="d:etc">etc</xhtml:a>. <xhtml:a href="d:easily">easily</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:the">the</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:mind">mind</xhtml:a><chnsep> e_inline="y"><und margined="n">These are all terms for the words and expressions people use when they speak or write, or for a particular style of speaking or writing.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以上各词均指措辞、用词或某种类型的言语。</chn></und></p><ul eid="language_ul_2" class="deflist" e_id="13cbabf992f.efa"><li eid="language_li_5" e_id="13cbabf992f.efb" e_inline="y"><unsyn>language</unsyn> <und margined="n">a particular style of speaking or writing<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指某种类型的言语或语言</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="language_xgs_7" e_id="13cbabf992f.efd"><x-g-blk eid="language_xg_20"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="language_x_20" e_id="13cbabf992f.eff" e_inline="y" tranID="5" status="6">Give your instructions in everyday language.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用通俗的语言发布指令。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="language_xg_21"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="language_x_21" e_id="13cbabf992f.f01" e_inline="y" tranID="7" status="6">the language of the legal profession<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>法律专业用语</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="language_li_6" e_id="13cbabf992f.f02" e_inline="y"><unsyn>vocabulary</unsyn> <und margined="n">all the words that a person knows or uses, or all the words in a particular language; the words that people use when they are talking about a particular subject<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指一个人掌握或使用的词汇、某种语言的词汇、某一学科的词汇</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="language_xgs_8" e_id="13cbabf992f.f04"><x-g-blk eid="language_xg_22"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="language_x_22" e_id="13cbabf992f.f06" e_inline="y" tranID="9" status="6">to have a wide/limited vocabulary<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>词汇丰富／有限</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="language_xg_"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="language_x_" e_id="13cbabf992f.f08" e_inline="y" tranID="11" status="6">The word has become part of advertising vocabulary.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>这个词已经成了广告用语。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="language_li_7" e_id="13cbabf992f.f09" e_inline="y"><unsyn>terms</unsyn> <und margined="n">a way of expressing yourself or of saying sth<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指表达方式、措辞、说法</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="language_xgs_9" e_id="13cbabf992f.f0b"><x-g-blk eid="language_xg_24"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="language_x_24" e_id="13cbabf992f.f0d" e_inline="y" tranID="13" status="6">I'll try to explain in simple terms.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我会尽量讲得通俗易懂。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="language_li_8" e_id="13cbabf992f.f0e" e_inline="y"><unsyn>wording</unsyn> <und margined="n"><gram-g><gram-blk> [<gram e_id=""><xhtml:a href="helpgr:ususing">usually singular</xhtml:a></gram>] </gram-blk></gram-g> the words that are used in a piece of writing or speech, especially when they have been carefully chosen<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指措辞、用词</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="language_xgs_10" e_id="13cbabf992f.f10"><x-g-blk eid="language_xg_25"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="language_x_25" e_id="13cbabf992f.f12" e_inline="y" tranID="15" status="6">It was the standard form of wording for a consent letter.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>这是同意书的标准用词。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="language_li_9" e_id="13cbabf992f.f13" e_inline="y"><unsyn>terminology</unsyn> <und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><q>rather</q> <reg reg="fml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:fml">formal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> the set of technical words or expressions used in a particular subject; words used with particular meanings<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指某学科的术语、有特别含义的用语、专门用语</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="language_xgs_11" e_id="13cbabf992f.f16"><x-g-blk eid="language_xg_26"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="language_x_26" e_id="13cbabf992f.f18" e_inline="y" tranID="17" status="6">medical terminology<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>医学术语</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="language_xg_27"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="language_x_27" e_id="13cbabf992f.f1a" e_inline="y" tranID="19" status="6">Scientists are constantly developing new terminologies.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>科学家不断发展新的专门用语。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><un un="note" e_id="13cbabf992f.f1b"> <boxtag>NOTE</boxtag> <und margined="n"><ei eid="language_ei_2" e_id="13cbabf992f.f1c">Literary/poetic terminology</ei> is used for talking about literature or poetry. <ei eid="language_ei_3" e_id="13cbabf992f.f1d">Literary/poetic language</ei> is used for writing in a literary or poetic style.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>literary/poetic terminology 用于谈论文学或诗歌，literary/poetic language 用于文学或诗歌创作。</chn></und></un></li></ul><h3 eid="language_h3_1" e_id="13cbabf992f.f1e" e_inline="y" tranID="27" status="1">Patterns</h3><ul eid="language_ul_3" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabf992f.f1f"><li eid="language_li_10" e_id="13cbabf992f.f20" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>formal/informal/everyday</eb>  language/vocabulary/terms</und></li><li eid="language_li_11" e_id="13cbabf992f.f22" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>business/scientific/technical/specialized</eb>  language/vocabulary/terminology</und></li><li eid="language_li_12" e_id="13cbabf992f.f24" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">A word  <eb>enters</eb>  the language/the vocabulary.</und></li></ul></body></unbox><xr-gs firstinblock="n" xt="see"><xrlabel> <xhtml:a href="helpxr:see"> <arrow>➡</arrow>  see also</xhtml:a> </xrlabel><xr-g-blk><xr-g e_inline="y"><unsyn>terminology</unsyn> <und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><q>rather</q> <reg reg="fml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:fml">formal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> the set of technical words or expressions used in a particular subject; words used with particular meanings<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指某学科的术语、有特别含义的用语、专门用语</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="language_xgs_11" e_id="13cbabf992f.f16"><x-g-blk eid="language_xg_26"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="language_x_26" e_id="13cbabf992f.f18" e_inline="y" tranID="17" status="6">medical terminology<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>医学术语</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="language_xg_27"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="language_x_27" e_id="13cbabf992f.f1a" e_inline="y" tranID="19" status="6">Scientists are constantly developing new terminologies.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>科学家不断发展新的专门用语。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><un un="note" e_id="13cbabf992f.f1b"> <boxtag>NOTE</boxtag> <und margined="n"><ei eid="language_ei_2" e_id="13cbabf992f.f1c">Literary/poetic terminology</ei> is used for talking about literature or poetry. <ei eid="language_ei_3" e_id="13cbabf992f.f1d">Literary/poetic language</ei> is used for writing in a literary or poetic style.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>literary/poetic terminology 用于谈论文学或诗歌，literary/poetic language 用于文学或诗歌创作。</chn></und></un></li></ul><h3 eid="language_h3_1" e_id="13cbabf992f.f1e" e_inline="y" tranID="27" status="1">Patterns</h3><ul eid="language_ul_3" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabf992f.f1f"><li eid="language_li_10" e_id="13cbabf992f.f20" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>formal/informal/everyday</eb>  language/vocabulary/terms</und></li><li eid="language_li_11" e_id="13cbabf992f.f22" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>business/scientific/technical/specialized</eb>  language/vocabulary/terminology</und></li><li eid="language_li_12" e_id="13cbabf992f.f24" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">A word  <eb>enters</eb>  the language/the vocabulary.</und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-g></licontent></xhtml:li></xhtml:ol></sn-blk><sn-blk shcut="n"><xhtml:ol start="4"><xhtml:li><licontent><sn-g eid="vocabulary_sng_4" n=""><v-gs-blk type="vf"> (<v-gs><v-g-blk><v-g><label-g-blk><label-g><reg-blk><vgslabel>also </vgslabel><reg e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3646" reg="infml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:infml">informal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g> </label-g-blk><v-blk><v e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3645"><xhtml:a href="d:vocab">vocab</xhtml:a></v></v-blk><pron e eid="vocabulary_prongs_2" gs vocal

<pos-blk><pos><xhtml:a href="helpp:adj">adjective</xhtml:a></pos></pos-blk></pos-g><res-g eid="vocal_resg_1"></res-g></top-g><sn-gs eid="vocal_sngs_1"><sn-blk shcut="n"><xhtml:ol noblk="y"><xhtml:a href="d:connected">connected</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:with">with</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:the">the</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:voice">voice</xhtml:a><chnsep> href="addexample:13cbac60ff3.-3621">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3620" e_inline="y" eid="vocal_x_2" status="6" tranid="3"><xhtml:a href="x:the">the</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="x:vocal">vocal</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="x:organs">organs</xhtml:a> <gl-blk>(= <gl><xhtml:a href="x:the">the</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="x:tongue">tongue</xhtml:a>, <xhtml:a href="x:lips">lips</xhtml:a>, <xhtml:a href="x:etc">etc</xhtml:a>.</gl>)</gl-blk> <xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>发声器官</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><unbox type="synonyms" Name="spoken" eid="spoken_unbox_1" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c7a"><body eid="spoken_body_1" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c7b"><title eid="spoken_h1_1" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c7c" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="21" status="1">spoken</titled></title><inlinelist><und margined="n">oral</und> ◇ <und margined="n">vocal</und></inlinelist><p eid="spoken_p_1" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c80" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">These words all describe producing language using the voice, rather than writing.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以上各词均指口头的、口语的。</chn></und></p><ul eid="spoken_ul_2" class="deflist" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c81"><li eid="spoken_li_3" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c82" e_inline="y"><unsyn>spoken</unsyn> <und margined="n"> (of language) produced using the voice; said rather than written<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指口语的、口头的</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="spoken_xgs_3" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c84"><x-g-blk eid="spoken_xg_5"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="spoken_x_5" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c86" e_inline="y" tranID="5" status="6">an exam in spoken English<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>英语口语考试</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="spoken_li_4" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c87" e_inline="y"><unsyn>oral</unsyn> <und margined="n"><gram-g><gram-blk> [<gram e_id=""><xhtml:a href="helpgr:ubn">usually before noun</xhtml:a></gram>] </gram-blk></gram-g> spoken rather than written<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指口头的、口述的</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="spoken_xgs_4" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c89"><x-g-blk eid="spoken_xg_6"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="spoken_x_6" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c8b" e_inline="y" tranID="7" status="6">There will be a test of both oral and written French.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>将有一次法语口试和笔试。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 eid="spoken_h3_1" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c8c" e_inline="y" tranID="8" status="6">spoken or oral?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用 spoken 还是 oral？</chn></h3><p eid="spoken_p_2" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c8d" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">Both of these words can be used to refer to language skills and the communication of information.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>上述两词均可用于语言技巧和信息交流</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="spoken_xgs_5" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c8e"><x-g-blk eid="spoken_xg_7"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="spoken_x_7" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c90" e_inline="y" tranID="10" status="6">spoken/oral French<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>法语口语</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="spoken_xg_8"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="spoken_x_8" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c92" e_inline="y" tranID="12" status="6">a spoken/oral presentation<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>口头报告</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">In these cases  <eb>oral</eb>  is slightly more technical than  <eb>spoken</eb>.  <eb>Oral</eb>  but not  <eb>spoken</eb>  can also be used with words such as <ei eid="spoken_ei_1" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c97">tradition</ei>, <ei eid="spoken_ei_2" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c98">culture</ei> and <ei eid="spoken_ei_3" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c99">legends</ei> to talk about the way in which people pass stories down from one generation to the next, and in legal contexts followed by words such as <ei eid="spoken_ei_4" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c9a">evidence</ei> and <ei eid="spoken_ei_5" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c9b">hearing</ei>. <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>在上述例子中，oral 较 spoken 专业一些，oral 亦可与 tradition、culture 和 legends 等词连用，指故事代代相传的方式；spoken 则不能这样用。在法律语境中，oral 后可接 evidence 和 hearing 等词，spoken 则不能。</chn></und></p><ul eid="spoken_ul_3" class="deflist" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c9c"><li eid="spoken_li_5" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c9d" e_inline="y"><unsyn>vocal</unsyn> <und margined="n"><gram-g><gram-blk> [<gram e_id=""><xhtml:a href="helpgr:ubn">usually before noun</xhtml:a></gram>] </gram-blk></gram-g> connected with the voice<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指嗓音的、发音的</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="spoken_xgs_6" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5c9f"><x-g-blk eid="spoken_xg_9"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="spoken_x_9" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5ca1" e_inline="y" tranID="15" status="6">vocal music<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>声乐</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="spoken_xg_10"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="spoken_x_10" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5ca3" e_inline="y" tranID="17" status="6">the vocal organs<gl-blk>(= <gl>the tongue, lips, etc.</gl>)</gl-blk> <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>发声器官</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><un un="note" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5ca5"> <boxtag>NOTE</boxtag> <und margined="n"> <eb>Vocal</eb>  is used to talk about the ability to produce sounds using the voice, and is often used in musical contexts when referring to singing.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>vocal 关乎发音的能力，常用于音乐语境中，指歌唱。</chn></und></un></li></ul><h3 eid="spoken_h3_2" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5ca7" e_inline="y" tranID="26" status="1">Patterns</h3><ul eid="spoken_ul_4" class="bullet" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5ca8"><li eid="spoken_li_6" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5ca9" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">spoken/oral  <eb>French/English/Japanese, etc.</eb> </und></li><li eid="spoken_li_7" e_id="13cbac43f7b.5cab" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">spoken/oral  <eb>language voiceless
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g voluntourism

about a vote within an organization rather than an occasion on which the public vote.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>ballot 通常用于机构内部的选举，而非公众的投票选举。</chn></und></un></li></ul><h3 eid="election_h3_1" policy<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>制定／执行国内经济政策</chn></und></li><li eid="politics_li_" e_id="13cbac28b3d.-67b0" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>change/influence/shape/have an impact on</eb> </chnsep><chn>参加选举</chn></h2><ul eid="vote_ul_1" class="bullet" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2bdd"><li eid="vote_li_1" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2bdc" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>conduct/hold</eb>  an election/a referendum<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>举行选举／全民公决</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_2" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2bda" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><q>especially</q> <xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk>  <eb>run for</eb>  office/election/governor/mayor/president/the White House<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>竞选公职；参加竞选；竞选州长／市长／总统／美国总统</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_3" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2bd6" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><q>especially</q> <xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk>  <eb>stand for</eb>  election/office/Parliament/the Labour Party/a second term<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>参加竞选；竞选公职／议会议员；当工党候选人；竞选连任</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_4" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2bd2" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>hold/call/contest</eb>  a general/national election<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>举行／要求／角逐大选／全国选举</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_5" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2bd0" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>launch/run</eb>  a presidential election campaign<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>开始总统竞选活动</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_6" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2bce" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>support/back</eb>  a candidate<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>支持候选人</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_7" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2bcc" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>sway/convince/persuade</eb>  voters/the electorate<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>说服选民／全体选民</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_8" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2bca" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>appeal to/attract/woo/target</eb>  <label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> swing voters/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> floating voters<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>吸引游离选民；寻求游离选民的支持；瞄准游离选民</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_9" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2bc4" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>fix/rig/steal</eb>  an election/the vote<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>操纵选举；暗中舞弊获取选票</chn></und></li></ul><h2 eid="vote_h2_2" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2bc2" e_inline="y" tranID="11" status="6">Voting<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>投票</chn></h2><ul eid="vote_ul_2" class="bullet" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2bc1"><li eid="vote_li_10" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2bc0" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>go to/be turned away from</eb>  <label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><q>especially</q> <xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> a polling station/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> a polling place<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>去／被拒绝进入投票站投票</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_11" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2bba" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>cast</eb>  a/your vote/ballot (for sb)<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>投（某人）一票</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_12" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2bb8" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>vote for</eb>  the Conservative candidate/the Democratic party<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>投票给保守党候选人／民主党</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_13" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2bb6" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>mark/spoil</eb>  your ballot paper<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>在选票上做标记；投废票</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_14" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2bb4" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>count</eb>  <label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> the postal votes/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><q>especially</q> <xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> the absentee ballots<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>清点邮寄选票数</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_15" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2bae" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>go to/be defeated at</eb>  the ballot box<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>去投票箱投票；竞选失败</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_16" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2bac" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>get/win/receive/lose</eb>  votes<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>赢得／失去选票</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_17" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2baa" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>get/win</eb>  (60% of) the popular/black/Hispanic/Latino/Muslim vote<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>赢得大众／黑人／拉美裔／穆斯林 (60%) 的选票</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_18" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2ba8" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>win</eb>  the election/(<ei eid="vote_ei_1" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2ba6">in the US</ei>) the primaries/a seat in Parliament/a majority/power<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>赢得大选／（美国的）初选／议会中的一个席位／多数票／权力</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_19" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2ba5" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>lose</eb>  an election/the vote/your majority/your seat<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>在选举中失败；失去多数人的支持／席位</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_20" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2ba3" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>win/come to power in</eb>  a landslide (victory) (= with many more votes than any other party)<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以压倒多数的选票获胜／掌权</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_21" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2ba1" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>elect/re-elect sb (as)</eb>  mayor/president/an MP/senator/congressman/congresswoman<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>选举／再度选举某人为市长／总统／议员／参议员／国会议员／国会女议员</chn></und></li></ul><h2 eid="vote_h2_3" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2b9f" e_inline="y" tranID="24" status="6">Taking power<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>掌权</chn></h2><ul eid="vote_ul_3" class="bullet" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2b9e"><li eid="vote_li_22" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2b9d" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>be sworn</eb>  into office/in as president<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>宣誓就职／就任总统</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2b9b" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>take/administer</eb>  (<ei eid="vote_ei_2" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2b99">in the US</ei>) the oath of office<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>（美国）宣誓就职；听取就职宣誓</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_24" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2b98" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>swear/take</eb>  (<ei eid="vote_ei_3" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2b96">in the UK</ei>) an/the oath of allegiance<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>（英国）宣誓效忠</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_25" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2b95" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>give/deliver</eb>  (<ei eid="vote_ei_4" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2b93">in the US</ei>) the president's inaugural address<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>发表（美国）总统就职演说</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_26" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2b92" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>take/enter/hold/leave</eb>  office<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>就职；任职；离职</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_27" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2b90" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>appoint sb (as)</eb>  ambassador/governor/judge/minister<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>任命某人为大使／州长／法官／部长</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_28" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2b8e" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>form</eb>  a government/a cabinet<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>组建政府／内阁</chn></und></li><li eid="vote_li_29" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2b8c" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>serve</eb>  two terms as prime minister/in office<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>任两届总理；两届任职</chn></und></li></ul><xr-gs xt="collocat"><xrhead> <arrow>➡</arrow> <xrbold><b>collocations</b></xrbold> at</xrhead><xr-g-blk><xr-g> <xh><xhtml:a firstinblock="n" xt="see"><xrlabel> <xhtml:a href="helpxr:see"> <arrow>➡</arrow>  see also</xhtml:a> </xrlabel><xr-g-blk><xr-g e_targeteltid="13cbabdc422.-9df"><xh-blk><xh><a vote sb out
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><pv-g href="xp:sb">sb</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="xp:out">ˈout</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="xp:of">of</xhtml:a>/<xhtml:a href="xp:off">ˈoff</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="xp:sth">sth</xhtml:a></pv></pv-blk></pv-l></top-g><sn-gs eid="vote_sngs_6"><sn-blk><sn-g eid="vote_sng_14" n=""><def neh="n" noblk="y"><xhtml:a href="d:to">to</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:dismiss">dismiss</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="help:sb">sb</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:from">from</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:a">a</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:position">position</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a e_id="13cbac60ff3.-2bed" eid="vote_xg_27"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbac60ff3.-2bed">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><rx e eid="vote_rxg_22" g href="vote_rxg_22" resource="recx" source="ald9" reception<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>邀请某人出席／参加婚礼／结婚典礼／结婚喜宴</chn></und></li><li eid="marriage_li_16" e_id="13cbac01393.3148" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>conduct/perform</eb>  a wedding husband/wife/partner/fiancé/fiancée/boyfriend/girlfriend<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>对丈夫／妻子／伴侣／未婚夫／未婚妻／男朋友／女朋友不忠</chn></und></li><li eid="marriage_li_22" e_id="13cbac01393.3159" e_inline="y"><und an engagement/a relationship<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>解除／终止婚约／恋爱关系</chn></und></li><li eid="marriage_li_24" e_id="13cbac01393.315d" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>break up with/split up with/</eb>
